Subject: New document, new Mac installer
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=44728387
X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

A new document has been posted to the Cantera sourceforge site.  It 
describes how to use Cantera to evaluate properties of several pure 
fluids with full liquid/vapor equations of state, including liquid, 
vapor, supercritical, and saturation states. (Five such fluids, 
including water, are implemented so far in Cantera.) You can do 
everything with Cantera that you could do with steam tables or similar 
property evaluation software, but you can do it in MATLAB or Python, 
which allows you to build complete simulations of vapor power cycles 
and similar processes.

The emphasis is on how to do this from MATLAB, although Python is 
discussed too.  An example of a Rankine cycle is presented.  The file 
name is "liquidvapor.pdf" in the Cantera Documentation package.

For fellow Mac users:
I have posted a binary installer for Cantera for Mac OS 10.3. It 
contains the Cantera Python package and MATLAB Toolbox for MATLAB 7 
(Release 14), plus the usual assortment of demos, etc.  It also 
contains MixMaster packaged as a Mac application, so you should be able 
to run it by just double-clicking its icon in the Finder (look in 
/Applications/Cantera), assuming you have tkinter installed. See 
appendix B of the above document for more on installation procedures.

Dave
